who.title: Who We Are
who.text1: M.G. Filtration Technology Ltd. is an Italian company specialized in the design and manufacture of membrane filters using tangential flow filtration technology, as well as in the development of customized installations for every need.
who.text2: We develop solutions for the treatment of water and liquids in industrial and civil sectors, using technologies such as Microfiltration, Ultrafiltration, Nanofiltration, and Reverse Osmosis.
who.text3: We have our own laboratory and pilot plants, which allow us to carry out preliminary tests, optimize processes, and select the most suitable membranes for each application.
who.text4: Thanks to partnerships with European universities, we also develop systems for water reuse and the recovery of valuable substances, combining membrane technologies to obtain reusable ultrapure water and reduce the environmental impact of industrial processes.

card1.title: Sustainability
card1.text: We develop systems that help reduce environmental impact by optimizing resource use and promoting circular economy practices in industrial processes.

card2.title: Innovation
card2.text: We invest in research and pilot testing to create efficient, industry-specific solutions using state-of-the-art membrane technologies.

card3.title: University Partnerships
card3.text: We collaborate with prestigious European universities to drive technological development and sustainability projects in water treatment.

card4.title: Water Reuse
card4.text: We design plants that purify and demineralize wastewater, making it safely reusable in production cycles.

step2.text: We conduct tests with small samples in our pilot plants to define the appropriate membrane and optimal filtration parameters.

step3.title: Tailor-Made Design
step3.text: We design and integrate a custom installation tailored to the specific needs of each client and their industry.

step4.title: Implementation
step4.text: We install the plant and provide ongoing technical support to ensure efficient and long-lasting performance.

aboutUs.text2: We focus on providing maximum technical support and professionalism to our clients by developing separation processes and plants tailored to each industry.

why.title: Why Choose Membrane Filtration?
why.subtitle: Unlike traditional separation methods (chemical precipitation, activated sludge, distillation, evaporation, cryo-separation, etc.), membrane technology offers key benefits.

card1.title: Microfiltration
card1.subtitle: Precision filtration for wines, beverages, food, and pharmaceutical products. Removes solids, bacteria, and turbidity without altering the product’s aroma or properties.
card1.subtitleContent: MTW-type plants are used in oenology, the beverage, food, and pharmaceutical industries.

applications.title: Applications by Industry
eonology: Designed to filter musts, wines, and vinegars during the clarification phase.
Processes products with turbidity up to 4000 NTU, ensuring output turbidity < 1 NTU.
Filtration index: between 5 and 9.
Eliminates the use of aids such as diatomaceous earth, filter plates, cartridges, etc.
Replaces traditional systems like centrifuges or slow filters.
beveragesAndFood: Microfiltration of surface water (eliminates 99.99% of bacteria).
Microfiltration of milk and whey at room temperature.
Microfiltration of liquid food products to remove suspended solids.
pharmaceuticals: Microfiltration of liquid medicines to remove bacteria and suspended solids.

advantages.title: Technology and Technical Advantages
list: Next-generation membranes with no electric charge.
Available configurations: manual, semi-automatic, or automatic.

benefits.title: Benefits
list: High efficiency without altering the product.
No need for additives or filtration aids.

card2.title: Ultrafiltration
card2.subtitle: Advanced technology for separating components such as proteins, polyphenols, or colorants in wines, food, and pharmaceutical products without altering their original properties.
card2.subtitleContent: Ultrafiltration plants by M.G. Filtration Technology are used in oenology, the beverage, food, and pharmaceutical industries.

applications.title: Applications by Industry
eonology: Treatment of musts, wines, and vinegars.
Obtaining two products (permeate and concentrate) organoleptically identical to the original but differing in anthocyanin and polyphenol content.
Allows for total or partial decolorization without altering other product parameters.
Replaces the traditional use of activated carbon.
Recovery factor: between 30% and 70%.
Constructed in AISI 316 stainless steel.
Available in semi-automatic or automatic configuration.
beveragesAndFood: Preserves the functional and nutritional values of the original product.
pharmaceuticals: Decolorization of generic drugs in liquid form.

advantages.title: Technology and Technical Advantages
list: Physical process developed in 2013 by M.G. Filtration Technology.
Total replacement of activated carbon with significant benefits: no carbon purchasing cost, no waste management cost, and preservation of aromas and color by avoiding chemical absorption losses.
Physical separation using membranes instead of chemical processes.

benefits.title: Benefits
list: Reduction in operational and waste management costs.
Safe and efficient alternative to activated carbon.

card3.title: Nanofiltration
card3.subtitle: Versatile solutions for concentrating, purifying, or removing specific compounds in wines, food, and pharmaceutical products, operating at high pressure with maximum precision.
card3.subtitleContent: MOVIRO-type plants by M.G. Filtration Technology are used in oenology, as well as in the beverage, food, and pharmaceutical industries.

applications.title: Applications by Industry
eonology: Extraction of water and sugars.
Neutralization of acids: malic, lactic, tartaric, acetic, and total acidity.
Removal of green tannins, pyrazines, ethylphenols, and odor-related molecules (such as Brettanomyces).
Concentration of anthocyanins, polyphenols, extracts, and alcohol.
Partial or total dealcoholization.
Tartaric stabilization.
Concentration of acetic degree.
beveragesAndFood: Concentration of juices, liquid foods, colorants, and proteins.
Separation and concentration of monovalent and trivalent salts.
pharmaceuticals: Purification and decolorization of chemical solutions.
Concentration of vitamins and active ingredients.

advantages.title: Technology and Technical Advantages
list: Operating pressure range from 3 to 100 bar, depending on the process and membrane used.
Compatible with spiral-wound Ultrafiltration, Nanofiltration, and Reverse Osmosis membranes.
Available in manual, semi-automatic, or automatic configuration.

benefits.title: Benefits
list: High versatility depending on membrane type (UF, NF, RO).
High concentration capacity with minimal impact on product quality.
Replacement of chemical processes with physical separation.
Energy and operational efficiency thanks to its design.
Suitable for multiple industries with a single adaptable system.

card5.title: Stabilization
card5.subtitle: Innovative solution to remove tartrates without altering the wine. Stabilizes white, rosé, red wines and musts at room temperature, preserving their organoleptic properties and reducing operating costs.
card5.subtitleContent: MOVIRO-type plants by M.G. Filtration Technology are used in oenology, as well as in the beverage, food, and pharmaceutical industries.

why.title: Why is Stabilization Necessary?
why.text: After potassium bitartrate precipitation, all wines must undergo a tartaric stabilization process to avoid unwanted crystallizations in the bottle. The plants developed by M.G. Filtration Technology offer a modern and effective alternative to traditional methods such as ion exchange resins, electrodialysis, and cold sedimentation.

howWork.title: How Does Membrane Stabilization Work?
howWork.text1: The system is based on membrane separation, achieving controlled supersaturation of tartaric acid and potassium. This causes crystal formation, which is then removed using next-generation filters.
howWork.text2: Subsequently, the wine is recombined with water, and using a conductivity sensor, the ideal equilibrium point is determined to ensure the tartaric stability of the final product.

version.title: Version for Small Wineries
version.text: For small wineries, a compact version of the system has been developed that uses two adjacent plants. Although it does not operate continuously, it guarantees the benefits of membrane stabilization with an optimized investment.

benefits.title: Benefits
list: Suitable for white, rosé, red wines, and musts.
Precise tartrate removal according to customer requirements.
